Package jess.awt

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • jess.awt.Canvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class Canvas
extends java.awt.Canvas

    Lets you do graphics on a java.awt.Canvas from Jess code.

    Construct one of these with the name of a 'painting' Userfunction as the first argument (a deffunction, usually.) The function should expect a Component as its first argument, and a java.awt.Graphics object as its second argument (both as RU.JAVA_OBJECTs).

    (C) 2013 Sandia Corporation
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Canvas

        public Canvas​(java.lang.String uf,
              Rete engine)
       throws JessException
        Will generally be called from Jess language code via reflection.
        Parameters:
        uf - The name of a Jess function to call when a paint() message arrives
        engine - The engine that should run the function
        Throws:
        JessException - If something goes wrong.

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The paint() method that all AWT components have. This implementation calls the Jess function named in the constructor argument. When that function is called, its first argument will be this JPanel object, and the second will be the graphics context.
        Overrides:
        paint in class java.awt.Canvas
        Parameters:
        g - A graphics context
